_comment: Created by NCODowd on 27/04/2016 10:33:37 using v2.7
title: How has alcohol related admissions to hospital changed?
analysis_commentary:
Alcohol misuse is estimated to cost the NHS about £3.3 billion per year and society as a whole £21 billion annually. Monitoring alcohol related hospital admissions supports the national ambitions to reduce harm set out in the Government's Alcohol Strategy.

Overall, the rate of alcohol related hospital admissions (from recorded primary diagnoses) has remained broadly stable from 2008/09 to 2013/14. The peak rate of alcohol related admissions was 653 admissions per 100,000 population in 2011/12, having increased slightly in the years since 2008/09. A small reduction was seen in 2012/13 to 637 alcohol related admissions per 100,000, but increased again in 2013/14.
data_source: Public Health England, Public Health Outcomes Framework indicator 2.18
